content.question:
Let R be the region in the first quadrant under the graph of <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>y</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mfrac> <mn>1</mn> <mrow> <msqrt> <mi>x</mi> </msqrt> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@39DB@</annotation> </semantics> </math> for 4 ≤ x ≤ 9.

(a) Find the area of R.

frqParts.text:
Let R be the region in the first quadrant under the graph of <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>y</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mfrac> <mn>1</mn> <mrow> <msqrt> <mi>x</mi> </msqrt> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@39DB@</annotation> </semantics> </math> for 4 ≤ x ≤ 9.

(a) Find the area of R.
(b) If the line x = k divides the region R into two regions of equal area, what is the value of k?
(c) Find the volume of the solid whose base is the region R and whose cross sections cut by planes perpendicular to the x-axis are squares.

topic.text: 6.7: The Fundamental Theorem of Calculus and Definite Integrals

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
